name: site
content:
site noun [C]
(PLACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 a place where something is, was, or will be built, or where something happened, is happening, or will happen: a building site The company hasn't yet chosen the site for the new hospital. This is the site of the accident. on site
C1 inside a factory, office building, etc.: There are two restaurants on site. The office complex has an on-site nursery. off site
away from a factory, office building, etc.: The next time the meeting had to be held off site. It is more difficult to manage off-site employees.
More examplesFewer examplesa derelict siteThey're planning to develop the whole site into a shopping complex.Armed guards are posted around the site.Houses have been built on the periphery of the factory site.So far, only the westerly part of the site has been developed.
